creator: stevec@ignitesports.com
text:
<property file=>
When reading in properties from a properties file, ant does not strip them so
any spaces at the end of a property are passed in.  This is almost certainly not
what the user wants.  I discovered it when the <ftp> task failed.  I pulled my
hair out for awhile until I realized that the properties file from which I was
reading data had spaces after my username.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
How would you define a property with a space at the end if Ant stripped them?

Ant's behavior is consistent with the Java Properties class (actually, Ant uses
Properties#load) and changing it would break a valid use case.
